title: England opt to bowl against South Africa in Women’s World Cup semi-final
byline: England skipper Nat Sciver-Brunt won the toss and elected to field against South Africa in the first semi-final of the Women’s World Cup in India’s Guwahati city on Wednesday.

title: Red Shirts see Danger ahead of New Season
byline: One of the leading contenders of the new rugby season, CR and FC, will have to come to grips with a series of major injuries ahead of the start of the inter club League tournament set to be kicked off on November 14.

title: Hurricane Melissa leaves dozens dead and trail of destruction across Caribbean
byline: Hurricane Melissa has continued its devastating sweep across the Caribbean, decimating homes and infrastructure, flooding neighbourhoods and leaving dozens dead.

title: Teenage cricketer dies in Melbourne after being hit by ball
byline: An Australian teenager has died after he was hit by a cricket ball during a practice session in Melbourne.

title: Former envoy Kananathan congratulates President Paul Biya on re-election
byline: Former Kenyan envoy, Ambassador Kananathan, has extended his warm congratulations to H.E. President Paul Biya on his re-election as President of the Republic of Cameroon for an eighth term. President Biya, who has led the nation for several decades, is recognized as one of the longest-serving Heads of State in the world.

title: Kottahachchi denies appearing in photo with Mahinda
byline: National People’s Power MP Nilanthi Kottahachchi has clarified that she is not the person seen with former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in a photo circulating on social media.

title: Two suspects partially admit involvement in Louvre heist, prosecutor says
byline: Two men arrested in connection with the Louvre theft two weeks ago have ’’partially recognised’’ their involvement in the brazen heist, according to officials.

title: Engine driver who allegedly knocked down 7 elephants faces legal battle
byline: Filing a Fundamental Rights petition before the Supreme Court, a group of environmental activists has sought an order calling for disciplinary and legal action against a 67-year-old engine driver who has allegedly been involved in seven separate elephant fatalities on the Batticaloa–Colombo railway line.

title: Trump and Xi meet for first time in six years
byline: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump have begun a landmark meeting in South Korea that could reset the volatile relationship between the world’s two largest economies and rival superpowers.

title: Nationwide anti-drug campaign ‘Ratam Ekata’ launches today
byline: The government’s new national program to eradicate drug abuse, titled “Ratam Ekata – National Mission,” is set to launch today under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium in Colombo.

title: Sri Lanka’s ageing rate among highest in Asia
byline: Sri Lanka has been identified as one of the countries with the fastest-growing elderly populations in Asia, health officials said yesterday.

title: Billions in dues from medical officers who quit service
byline: A special audit has uncovered serious lapses in the recovery of government dues from medical officers who have left the public health service for postgraduate studies, foreign employment, and other reasons, resulting in more than Rs. 1.1 billion in outstanding payments to the state.

title: GMOA to launch islandwide strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) will launch an islandwide trade union action tomorrow (31) in protest against what it describes as an arbitrary transfer procedure being implemented by the Ministry of Health.

title: Bag containing gas cartridges found on roof of Colombo building
byline: The Cinnamon Gardens Police recovered a bag containing 10 gas cartridges on the roof of the Commons Coffeehouse building located on Flower Road, Colombo 7.

title: Strong people’s movement will be formed to eradicate drug menace: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today stressed that a strong people’s movement will be formed to eradictae the drug menace while calling drug addicts and drug dealers to stop their illegal practices.

title: Trump directs nuclear weapons testing to resume for first time in over 30 years
byline: President Donald Trump called on US military leaders to resume testing US nuclear weapons in order to keep pace with other countries such as Russia and China.

title: GBS Technology breaks silence on Auditor General’s eVisa report
byline: In response to the Special Audit Report issued by the Auditor General’s Department on the Online Visa Issuance Methodology of the Department of Immigration and Emigration, GBS Technology Services Pte Ltd clarified that as the prime contractor, they agreed with the Department of Immigration and Emigration to collect and remit to the Department the visa revenues.

title: China tightens the screws: Influencers now need degrees to speak on finance, health, law
byline: In a move that could reshape online content creation, China has introduced a new rule requiring influencers to have official qualifications before discussing “sensitive” subjects such as medicine, law, education, or finance online.

title: Legal action to be taken over Rs. 120 million lottery scam: NLB Chairman
byline: Strict legal action will be taken against the wife of MP Hesha Withanage and the sister-in-law of former Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, National Lotteries Board (NLB) Chairman M.D.C.A. Perera said.

title: Lawyer provided Bar ID, tie and vehicle pass to courthouse killer
byline: A female lawyer residing in Kadawatha was arrested yesterday by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for allegedly aiding and abetting those involved in the murder of Ganemulla Sanjeewa, who was shot dead in February 2025 at the Colombo Magistrate’s Court premises.

title: Trump and Xi meet for first time in six years
byline: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump have begun a landmark meeting in South Korea that could reset the volatile relationship between the world’s two largest economies and rival superpowers.

title: Hurricane Melissa leaves dozens dead and trail of destruction across Caribbean
byline: Hurricane Melissa has continued its devastating sweep across the Caribbean, decimating homes and infrastructure, flooding neighbourhoods and leaving dozens dead.

title: 18 Army athletes promoted for outstanding South Asian athletics performance
byline: Eighteen Sri Lanka Army athletes were promoted to their substantive ranks in recognition of their exceptional performances at the 4th South Asian Senior Athletics Championship 2025 held in Ranchi, India.

title: Head monk found guilty of sexually abusing children
byline: The head monk of a Buddhist temple in  Melbourne, Australia has been found guilty of sexually abusing children aged as young as four.

title: Trial begins in case against former State Minister Diana Gamage
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanaga S. Bodaragama today commenced the examination of evidence in the case filed by the Criminal Investigation Department against former State Minister Diana Gamage, who is accused of submitting false information to the Controller General of Immigration and Emigration in order to obtain a passport and remaining in Sri Lanka without a valid visa.

title: ADB reaffirms support for Sri Lanka’s port development
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has once again confirmed its commitment to support the development of Sri Lanka’s port sector.

title: Five new suspects arrested over Louvre jewellery theft
byline: Five more suspects have been arrested over their involvement in the Louvre heist, Paris’ public prosecutor has said.

title: NTC begins data collection to regulate transport services
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has launched a data collection programme to regulate transport services, including three-wheelers, school transport, office transport, taxis, and special services, NTC Director General Commander (Rtd) Dr. Nilan Miranda said.

title: Chinese gym offers Porsche reward for 50 kg weight loss in three months
byline: A gym in China drew mixed reactions after promising a Porsche for 50kg weight loss in three months.

title: New additional commissioner general assumes duties at DMT
byline: K.P.N. Tharaka Niroshan Devapriya officially assumed duties today as the new Additional Commissioner General of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT), marking an important milestone for the institution.

title: CSE Ends Mixed as Selective Buying Lifts ASPI
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed Thursday’s session on a mixed note, with the All-Share Price Index (ASPI) ending in positive territory while the S&P SL20 edged slightly lower.

title: Trump shaves China tariffs in deal with Xi on fentanyl, rare earths
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had agreed with President Xi Jinping to trim tariffs on China in exchange for Beijing cracking down on the illicit fentanyl trade, resuming U.S. soybean purchases and keeping rare earths exports flowing.

title: Five excise officers arrested by CID
byline: Five officers attached to the Narcotics Bureau of the Excise Department have been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Rare wolf spider rediscovered after 40 years
byline: A critically endangered spider, not seen in the UK for 40 years, has been rediscovered in a remote nature reserve accessible only by boat.

title: Two million people living with diabetes: Experts warn diabetic wounds deadlier than cancer
byline: The Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA) has raised alarm over the growing number of diabetic patients in the country, revealing that at least two million Sri Lankans are currently living with diabetes, with around 40,000 developing new wounds each year.

title: GMOA to launch island-wide strike tomorrow
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to launch an island-wide strike starting from 8.00 a.m. tomorrow (31) in protest against ongoing issues in the health sector.

title: Sri Lanka’s child population declines as elderly numbers rise: Census 2024
byline: Sri Lanka’s total population stands at 21.78 million, according to the 2024 Census of Population and Housing, with females making up 51.7% and males 48.3% of the population.

title: Rs. 26.5m in cigarettes found hidden in furniture from UAE
byline: Customs officers have uncovered a large stock of smuggled cigarettes worth over Rs. 26.5 million concealed inside a shipment of furniture imported from the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

title: Sri Lanka suspends mandatory ETA requirement for visitors
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has announced that the previously mandated Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) for all short-stay visitors (tourism and business) to Sri Lanka, which was to take effect from 15 October 2025, has been temporarily revoked until further notice.

title: Sri Lanka to get its first cosmetic product testing laboratory
byline: The foundation stone for Sri Lanka’s first Human Repeat Insult Patch Test (HRIPT) laboratory, dedicated to cosmetic product testing, was laid today under the patronage of Minister of Industries and Enterprise Development, Sunil Handunneththi.

title: TRCSL launches 1818 hotline to report drug-related activities
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) has introduced a 24-hour hotline, 1818, to support the government’s new initiative to eradicate the threat of narcotics, titled “United as a Nation – National Drive.”

title: Handunnetti’s FR against alleged sugar fraud fixed for January
byline: The Fundamental Rights petition filed by Minister Sunil Handunnetti, while he was in the opposition, seeking an order to recover Rs. 15.9 billion from those responsible for the alleged sugar fraud that occurred during sugar imports in 2020, was today fixed for support by the Supreme Court.

title: President warns police officers linked to drug networks to leave or face removal
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today issued a stern warning to Police officers allegedly involved in drug trafficking networks, urging them to immediately withdraw or face disciplinary action.
